All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
Bishop
Represents a bishop on the board
BitMap
Encapsulates a long that stores a 64 bit bitmap.
Board
Represents a position during a chess match.
BoardPanel
Represents a view of a board.
BoardPanel.MoveSoundType
 
ChessEngine
An abstract class that represents a chess engine (that can determine the best move in a given position)
EvalBar
Represents an evaluation bar (showing the current advantage of either side on a black-white slider)
EvaluatedMove
A move with optional evaluation attached to it.
Fonts
Supplies custom fonts
GameAnalyzerFrame
This is a frame, on which the user can analyze their games (given via pgn string)
GameEndedDialog
A popup that is displayed when a match terminates.
GameState
Represents the state of a given position (match).
King
Represents a king on the board
Knight
Represents a knight on the board
MainApplication
The entry point of the program
Menu
The class containing all the menu logic.
MinimaxEngine
A chess engine that uses the minimax algorithm to determine the best move.
MonteCarloEngine
Implements the Monte Carlo Tree Search algorithm with move ordering in the simulation phase to get better results.
Move
Represents a move in the game.
MoveResult
This is a helper class that is returned by the piece when generating the pseudo legal moves.
Pawn
Represents a pawn on the board
PGNBuilder
This is a class with which PGN output can be constructed.
PGNReader
This class parses PGN string and reads the moves and boards (positions).
Piece
Represents a piece on the board
PieceColor
Represents the color (side) of a piece
PieceFactory
This is used during parsing to create pieces.
PrimaryButton
Represents the button to use in the application for most purposes.
PromotionPopupMenu
Represents a popup, on which the user can select the type of piece they want to promote to.
PuzzleSolverFrame
The frame containing the controller for the puzzle solving use-case.
PvEGameFrame
The frame, containing the controller for the person versus engine use-case.
PvPGameFrame
The frame, containing the controller for the person versus person use-case.
Queen
Represents a queen on the board
RandomEngine
This is an engine mainly used for fun or for testing purposes.
Rook
Represents a rook on the board
Settings
Represents the application settings (preferences).
SlidingPiece
This is a type of piece (namely: rook, bishop, queen)
SpecialMove
This is a move flag.
Square
Represents a square on the board.
TranspositionTable
Implements a transposition table using Zobrist hashing
ZobristHash
This is a special kind of hashing function, commonly used in chess engines.
